name: 3,3,3-trifluoro-2-hydroxy-2-(trifluoromethyl)propionic acid
Reason: 3,3,3-trifluoro-2-hydroxy-2-(trifluoromethyl)propionic acid has a melting point influenced by functional groups relative to the base melting point of benzene, which is around 5.5°C. The trifluoromethyl group introduces a significant dipole, increasing intermolecular forces and melting point by approximately +50°C. The fluorine atoms also contribute to the melting point due to their high electronegativity, which raises the melting point by approximately +10°C per fluorine. The hydroxyl group introduces hydrogen bonding potential, which can lower the melting point by approximately -10°C. The carbonyl group introduces polar carbonyl interactions, contributing approximately +40°C. The trifluoromethyl group also introduces a rigid structure, which can participate in dipole interactions and raise the melting point by approximately +20°C. The presence of three fluorine atoms increases the molecular weight and van der Waals interactions, with an approximate increase of +60°C.
